summary:
Norse mythology is a collection of stories from the North Germanic people, including gods like Thor, Odin, and Freyja. These myths come from old religious beliefs and folklore. They tell about the gods' adventures and their relationships with humans and other beings called jötnar. The universe in these stories has nine worlds connected by a big tree named Yggdrasil.

The myths also talk about the creation of the world from a giant named Ymir and the first humans, Ask and Embla. They predict a big battle, Ragnarök, after which the world will start again, with new gods and people. People have been studying these myths since the 17th century, and they've influenced modern movies, books, and even religion.
title: Norse mythology
